prompt: Facts: Marriage between appellant (Sri Lokesh) and deceased (Shilpa) solemnized on 11.04.2010.; Alleged demand for dowry (Rs. 1 lakh cash, 50 grams gold) made by appellant's family before marriage.; Partial fulfillment of demand reported (Rs. 50,000 cash, 35 grams gold provided by deceased's family).; Allegations of continued demands for the remaining dowry amount and associated harassment/cruelty after marriage.; Deceased informed her father (PW-1) about alleged harassment over dowry approximately 15 days before her death.; Deceased (Shilpa) died by suicide (hanging) at her matrimonial home on 21.08.2010, within approximately 4 months of marriage.; FIR lodged by deceased's father (PW-1) on 21.08.2010.; Initial investigation included Section 306 IPC, but charge sheet filed under Sections 498A and 304B IPC against the appellant (husband) and his mother (Accused No. 2).; Trial Court (Sessions Judge, Mandya) acquitted both accused on 30.10.2012, citing failure to prove cruelty 'soon before death' and noting contradictions in witness testimonies (PW-1, PW-2, PW-3).; State of Karnataka appealed the acquittal to the High Court of Karnataka.; High Court, on 07.12.2017, reversed the Trial Court's decision regarding the appellant (husband), convicting him under Sections 498A and 304B IPC. Sentenced to 7 years RI for 304B and 1 year RI + fine for 498A (concurrent). Acquittal of the mother (Accused No. 2) was upheld.; Appellant (Sri Lokesh) filed the present appeal before the Supreme Court challenging the High Court's conviction. | IPC: Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 304B (Dowry death), Section 306 (Abetment of suicide - Considered initially but not charged)
